meanings.sent1: I will withhold my dessert until you finish your vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She decided to withhold her approval until further information was provided.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to withhold the toy mouse from its owner.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a dam trying to withhold a flood of tears.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to withhold the reveal until the very end.

meanings.sent1: The bank may withhold a portion of your deposit for security purposes.
meanings.sent2: He chose to withhold some of the information to protect his privacy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to withhold the acorn from the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to withhold the sunlight, casting a shadow over the valley.
meanings.sent5: The lockbox was designed to withhold valuable items securely.

meanings.sent1: She had to withhold her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to withhold the suspect from running away.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to withhold his excitement about the upcoming birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The strong chains could not withhold the force of the raging river.
meanings.sent5: The knight's shield could withhold the enemy's fierce attacks.
